analysisEngineMetaData.name: de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.tokit.TokenMerger
analysisEngineMetaData.description: Merges any Tokens that are covered by a given annotation type. E.g. this component can be used to create a single tokens from all tokens that constitute a multi-token named entity.

configurationParameter.name: annotationType
configurationParameter.description: Annotation type for which tokens should be merged.

configurationParameter.name: constraint
configurationParameter.description: A constraint on the annotations that should be considered in form of a JXPath statement. Example: set #PARAM_ANNOTATION_TYPE to a NamedEntity type and set the #PARAM_CONSTRAINT to ".[value = 'LOCATION']" to merge only tokens that are part of a location named entity.

configurationParameter.name: lemmaMode
configurationParameter.description: Configure what should happen to the lemma of the merged tokens. It is possible to JOIN the lemmata to a single lemma (space separated), to REMOVE the lemma or LEAVE the lemma of the first token as-is.

configurationParameter.name: posValue
configurationParameter.description: Set a new POS value for the new merged token. This is the actual tag set value and is subject to tagset mapping. For example when merging tokens for named entities, the new POS value may be set to "NNP" (English/Penn Treebank Tagset).

configurationParameter.name: posType
configurationParameter.description: Set a new POS tag for the new merged token. This is the mapped type. If this is specified, tag set mapping will not be performed. This parameter has no effect unless PARAM_POS_VALUE is also set.

configurationParameter.name: language
configurationParameter.description: Use this language instead of the document language to resolve the model and tag set mapping.
